text: Malaria is a mosquito-borne infectious disease. It spreads through the bite of infected Anopheles mosquitoes. Symptoms usually appear 10–15 days after the bite and include fever, chills, headache, nausea, and sweating. If not treated, malaria can become severe and cause complications. Malaria prevention includes using mosquito nets, insect repellents, and taking preventive medicines in high-risk areas. Treatment involves antimalarial drugs prescribed by healthcare professionals.
